rule.description: Cyberark-Vault Logs.
Cyberark-Vault Logs.
CyberArk-Vault: User Authentication Failure.
rule.info: Description: This rule detects failed user authentication attempts within CyberArk Vault, indicating that a user was unable to successfully log in. This could point to incorrect credentials or potential unauthorized access attempts.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Unauthorized deletion of directory map.
rule.info: Description: This rule detects the unauthorized deletion of a directory map within CyberArk Vault, which could indicate a potential security breach or malicious attempt to disrupt file organization. Immediate investigation is required to assess the impact and prevent further unauthorized actions.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Unauthorized Updation in Trusted Network Areas.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects an Unauthorized updation in trusted network areas occurs when changes are made to sensitive configurations or data in CyberArk Vault without proper authorization.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Possible addition of a safe by an unauthorized user.
rule.info: Description: The rule monitors and alerts the potential addition of a new safe in CyberArk Vault by an unauthorized user. Ensures that only authorized personnel can create or modify safes to maintain system security.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Potential inclusion or alteration of Owner.
rule.info: Description: the rule detects potential unauthorized inclusion or alteration of an owner in CyberArk Vault.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Deletion of File by an unauthorized user.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects and alerts on unauthorized attempts to delete files within CyberArk Vault

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Failure to reconcile password in CPM.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects instances where the CyberArk Vault fails to update or reconcile a managed account's password through the Central Policy Manager (CPM), potentially indicating an issue with credential management or system misconfiguration.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Possible Deletion of Location.
rule.info: Description: The rule identifies attempts or actions that may lead to the deletion of a location within the CyberArk Vault, which could indicate unauthorized changes or mismanagement of critical vault components.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Deletion of a User History by an unauthorized user.
rule.info: Description: The rule identifies attempts by unauthorized users to delete audit logs or user history within the CyberArk Vault, which could indicate malicious activity or an attempt to cover up unauthorized actions.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Possible file opening operation by an unauthorized user.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects attempts by unauthorized users to access or open files within the CyberArk Vault, potentially signaling a security breach or unauthorized data access.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: The login failed due to the user's expired status.
rule.info: Description: The rule identifies failed login attempts where the user's account is inactive or expired, indicating potential issues with account management or unauthorized access attempts using outdated credentials.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Possible Deletion of a safe containing locked files.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects attempts to delete a safe within the CyberArk Vault that contains locked or protected files, which could indicate malicious intent or unauthorized actions aimed at bypassing security controls.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Possible Deletion of a safe by an unauthorized user.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects attempts by unauthorized users to delete a safe within the CyberArk Vault, which could indicate malicious activity or an attempt to compromise secured asset.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Deletion of Folder by Unauthorized User.
rule.info: Description: The rule identifies attempts by unauthorized users to delete folders within the CyberArk Vault, signaling potential unauthorized access or malicious activity aimed at disrupting data integrity.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Possible unauthorized unlocking of files.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects attempts by unauthorized users to unlock secured files within the CyberArk Vault, indicating potential security breaches or malicious activities aimed at accessing sensitive information.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Unauthorized addition of user.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects attempts to add a new user to the CyberArk Vault without proper authorization, potentially indicating a security breach or malicious activity aimed at expanding unauthorized access.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Unauthorized Deletion of User.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects attempts by unauthorized users to delete user accounts within the CyberArk Vault, which could indicate malicious intent to disrupt operations or erase audit trails.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Getting user details by unauthorized user.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects an unauthorized user attempting to access and retrieve user details from CyberArk's Vault, potentially exposing sensitive information and violating security protocols.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Possible updation of owner by an unauthorized user.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects describes an unauthorized user attempting to update or change the ownership of credentials or accounts stored in the CyberArk Vault.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Unauthorized use of password.
rule.info: Description: The rule refers to an event where an attempt was made to access a stored password without proper authorization, potentially indicating a security breach or misuse of credentials.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Deletion of group member.
rule.info: Description: The rule refers to an event where a member is removed from a security group, potentially altering access permissions. This rule monitors such deletions to detect unauthorized or suspicious activity.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Deletion of rule.
rule.info: Description: the rule refers to an event where a security rule is removed from the vault, potentially impacting the system's security settings.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Possible Keystrokes event occured.
rule.info: Description: The rule refers to an event where keystrokes are detected, potentially indicating manual interaction with the vault. This rule monitors for unauthorized or suspicious keystroke activity that could suggest an attempted security breach.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: User deletion failed.
rule.info: Description: Detect and alert on failed attempt to delete a user in CyberArk Vault.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Logon Failed - User Account Disabled
rule.info: Description: The rule detect and alert if user is disabled in CyberArk Vault.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: User History is been cleared.
rule.info: Description: the rule detect and alert if user history has been cleared in cyberark-vault.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: SQL Command audit failed.
rule.info: Description: The failure of the SQL command audit in CyberArk Vault indicates an inability to log and track SQL queries executed within the vault, potentially leading to gaps in audit trails and challenges in maintaining security and compliance. This failure can hinder the detection and investigation of unauthorized or malicious database activities.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Delete Group Member - Sync From Ldap.
rule.info: Description: The "Delete Group Member - Sync From LDAP" action in CyberArk Vault refers to the removal of a user from a group within the vault, synchronized with LDAP (Lightweight Directory Access Protocol) to ensure alignment with the organization's directory services.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Activate/Deactivate Trusted Network Areas.
rule.info: Description: The CyberArk Vault allows you to activate or deactivate Trusted Network Areas to control which networks have trusted access to your secure vault environment.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Non authorized impersonation
rule.info: Description: Unauthorized impersonation in CyberArk Vault occurs when an individual gains access to a privileged account without proper authorization, potentially using stolen credentials or exploiting vulnerabilities.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Clear Safe History.
rule.info: Description: These rule in CyberArk Vault involves removing or modifying historical records of actions performed within a safe, potentially to erase traces of unauthorized activity.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: PSM Disconnect.
rule.info: Description: The rule refers to the termination of a session in CyberArk Privileged Session Management (PSM), which controls and monitors privileged access.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Full Gateway Connection.
rule.info: Description: The rule in CyberArk Vault involves establishing a comprehensive connection through a gateway, enabling full access to or control over systems and data managed by CyberArk.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Logon Event Detected.
rule.info: Description: The rule in CyberArk Vault indicates that a login attempt to the Vault system has been recorded, whether successful or failed.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Logon Event Detected for IFFCOADMIN.
rule.info: Description: The rule in CyberArk Vault indicates that a login attempt to the Vault system for IFFCOADMIN has been recorded

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Deletion of File Event Detected.
rule.info: Description: "Deletion of File Event Detected" in CyberArk Vault indicates that a file within the Vault system has been removed or deleted, which could involve critical configuration or security files.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: DR Replication end event detected.
rule.info: Description: The rule in CyberArk Vault indicates the completion of a disaster recovery (DR) replication process, which synchronizes data between primary and backup systems.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: DR Replication start event detected.
rule.info: Description: The rule in CyberArk Vault indicates the initiation of a disaster recovery replication process, which begins the synchronization of data between primary and backup systems.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Use Password event detected.
rule.info: Description: The rule identifies and alerts on any instance where a stored password is retrieved and used from the CyberArk Vault. This ensures monitoring of password usage to prevent unauthorized access and maintain security compliance.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: PSM Connect event detected.
rule.info: Description: The rule identifies and alerts on any activity related to the initiation of a privileged session through CyberArk's PSM. This ensures that all privileged access is monitored and logged for security and compliance.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Partial Gateway Connection event.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects incomplete or disrupted gateway connections, potentially affecting secure access and requiring prompt investigation.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: File Write Access Detected.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects file write access, which may indicate attempts to modify or tamper with sensitive files.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Monitor FW rules end.
rule.info: Description: The rule monitor firewall rules for changes or updates. Alerts on any modifications to ensure security policies are enforced and system integrity is maintained.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Set password event detected.
rule.info: Description: the rule detects events where passwords are set or changed, potentially indicating account updates or unauthorized password resets.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Creation of file version event detected.
rule.info: Description: the rule detects events where a new file version is created, which may indicate updates, modifications, or potential unauthorized changes to critical files. Monitoring these events helps ensure file integrity and security.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: PSM window titles event detected.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects events related to PSM window titles, which may indicate user activities or attempts to interact with specific applications. Monitoring these events can help identify suspicious behavior or unauthorized access.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: PSM upload recording event detected.
rule.info: Description: The rule indicates that a recording from a Privileged Session Manager (PSM) session has been uploaded to the CyberArk Vault, which stores and manages session recordings for security and auditing purposes.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Backup metadata preparation event detected.
rule.info: Description: The event indicates that the CyberArk Vault has initiated the process of preparing metadata for a backup. This metadata includes crucial information about the contents and structure of the backup.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Store file event detected.
rule.info: Description: The rule signifies that a file has been successfully stored in the CyberArk Vault. This action is recorded for security and auditing purposes to ensure proper management of stored files.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Backup of safe event detected
rule.info: Description: The rule indicates that a backup operation for a specific safe within the CyberArk Vault has occurred. This ensures that the safeâ€™s contents are preserved and can be restored if needed.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Password retrieval event detected.
rule.info: Description: The rule indicates that a password has been accessed or retrieved from the CyberArk Vault. This action is logged to ensure proper monitoring and auditing of sensitive credential access.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Metadata file retrieval event detected.
rule.info: Description: The rule indicates that a metadata file has been accessed or fetched from the CyberArk Vault. This action is logged to track and audit the retrieval of important system information.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: File category update event detected.
rule.info: Description: The event indicates that a file's category within the CyberArk Vault has been modified. This action is logged to ensure proper tracking of changes to file classification and organization.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: File retrieval succeeded event detected.
rule.info: Description: The event indicates that a file has been successfully accessed and retrieved from the CyberArk Vault. This action is logged to ensure proper auditing and monitoring of file access activities.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: File category addition event detected.
rule.info: Description: The event indicates that a new category has been added to a file within the CyberArk Vault. This action is logged to track changes in file classification and ensure proper management of file organization.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: File access event detected.
rule.info: Description: The file access event was detected in the CyberArk Vault, indicating that a specific file within the vault has been accessed.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Agent successfully updated the account password.
rule.info: Description: This rule detects successful password changes performed by an agent within the CyberArk Vault. Such events are crucial for maintaining secure and up-to-date credentials, minimizing the risk of unauthorized access to sensitive accounts.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: User Group Assignment Detection.
rule.info: Description: This rule detects when a user is assigned to a group within the CyberArk Vault, which may affect their access permissions and roles. Monitoring these assignments is essential for maintaining proper access control and ensuring that users only have the necessary permissions.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Unauthorized Firewall Network Areas Refresh Detected.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects unauthorized attempts to refresh or update Firewall Network Areas within CyberArk Vault. Such actions may indicate a potential security breach or unauthorized configuration change.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Unauthorized Station.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects when an unauthorized station or device attempts to access the CyberArk Vault. Such events may indicate potential security breaches or unauthorized access attempts from an unrecognized source.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Unauthorized File Access Detected.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects attempts to retrieve files from CyberArk Vault without proper authorization. Such actions could indicate unauthorized access or potential data breaches, highlighting a need for further investigation.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Authentication Failure of User - IFFCOADMIN.
rule.info: Description: This rule detects failed user authentication attempts within CyberArk Vault, indicating that a IFFCOADMIN user was unable to successfully log in.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: User Creation event detected.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects when a new user has been created in the CyberArk Vault, ensuring secure access and management of privileged accounts.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: User Creation by IFFCOADMIN.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects when IFFCOADMIN creates a new user in the CyberArk Vault, ensuring secure access and management of privileged accounts.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: The IFFCOADMIN user has been created.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects when IFFCOADMIN user has been created in the CyberArk Vault, ensuring secure access and management of privileged accounts.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: User Deletion event detected.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects when any user deletion event detected in the CyberArk Vault, ensuring secure access and management of privileged accounts.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: User Deletion by IFFCOADMIN.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects when IFFCOADMIN deletes any user in the CyberArk Vault, ensuring secure access and management of privileged accounts.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: The IFFCOADMIN user has been deleted.
rule.info: Description: The rule detects when IFFCOADMIN user has been deleted in the CyberArk Vault, ensuring secure access and management of privileged accounts

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Master Policy has been modified.
rule.info: Description: This rule detects when the Master Policy in CyberArk Vault is modified by IFFCOADMIN, highlighting potential changes to critical security settings. Such modifications can impact the overall security posture and access control within the organization.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Master Policy modified by IFFCOADMIN.
rule.info: Description: This rule detects when the Master Policy in CyberArk Vault is modified by IFFCOADMIN, highlighting potential changes to critical security settings. Such modifications can impact the overall security posture and access control within the organization.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Privileged Command executed.
rule.info: Description: This rule detects when user executes a privileged command in CyberArk Vault, indicating a potentially sensitive action. Monitoring these actions is crucial to ensure they are authorized and do not compromise security.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Privileged Command executed by IFFCOADMIN.
rule.info: Description: This rule detects when IFFCOADMIN executes a privileged command in CyberArk Vault, indicating a potentially sensitive action. Monitoring these actions is crucial to ensure they are authorized and do not compromise security.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Privileged Command executed.
rule.info: Description: This rule detects when user executes a privileged command in CyberArk Vault, indicating a potentially sensitive action. Monitoring these actions is crucial to ensure they are authorized and do not compromise security.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Password Brute Force Attempt by an unauthorized user.
rule.info: Description: The rule refers to a brute force attempt to access a stored password without proper authorization, potentially indicating a security breach. This rule triggers when 50 such attempts occur within a 15-seconds timeframe.

rule.description: CyberArk-Vault: Multiple User Authentication Failures.
rule.info: Description: This rule detects 50 failed user authentication attempts within 10 seconds in CyberArk Vault, indicating unsuccessful login attempts. This could suggest incorrect credentials or potential unauthorized access attempts.
